alert.note: Alert for Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 9:41AM CDT until August 03 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Iberville Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Pointe Coupee Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Western West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 941 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Plaquemine, St. Gabriel, Livonia, Maringouin, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Ramah and Erwinville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge
